text: Books about Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Clarence Thomas, John Roberts, and others reveal the personalities behind judicial decisions. More from @cray_kate in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing: https://t.co/eMDcXvCOLu

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It is easy to see why Trump appointees who work in institutions that deal with science and public health might be the first to break: Their jobs require them to grapple every day with data that they have to deny," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/MHUM5DitMe

name: TheAtlantic
text: It’s probably best to stay away from your gym for the moment. Here’s why, along with three stories we're following, in the latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/6f0iY6KFpN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Drones. Crowdsourcing apps. Pathogen-sniffing dogs. Scientists are stepping up their game in the fight against tree-killing pathogens, writes Stephanie Pain. https://t.co/tpIDmvBSDN
